contextId.information: AT: "Those whom enemy soldiers have killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Those who have been killed by the sword

contextId.information: Here "pits" refers to the enemies' trap, their plan to catch the king. AT: "the enemies made plans to capture our king, and they did capture him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"You have allowed strangers to take possession of our inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers
